name: Jack Palance
description: Academy Award-winning actor known for his roles in classics such as 'Shane' and 'City Slickers'.

content.title: Biography
content.body: **Jack Palance** was born on February 18, 1919, in Lattimer Mines, Pennsylvania, USA. Originally named Volodymyr Palahniuk, he was a son of Ukrainian immigrants. Before embarking on an acting career, Palance worked as a professional boxer and served in the United States Army Air Forces during World War II.

content.title: Career
content.body: Jack Palance's acting career began on Broadway; however, it was his transition to Hollywood that brought him fame. He made a mark with his performances in 1950s films such as _Shane_ and _Sudden Fear_, for which he received Academy Award nominations. His distinctive voice and impressive physique made him perfect for tough-guy roles. In 1991, he won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for his role in _City Slickers_.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Palance worked with several esteemed directors and actors throughout his career, including **Elia Kazan**, **Burt Lancaster**, and **Jack Nicholson**.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Jack Palance left a significant impact on the film industry with his iconic character portrayals, particularly in westerns and action films. His Oscar-winning performance in _City Slickers_ and live television push-up demonstration remain memorable moments in Hollywood history.
